articles.title: Indian Parliament in 2025: From VB-G RAM G to Waqf and Constitution amendment — Key bills that sparked debate
articles.summary: While the government did not accept the Opposition's demand for an urgent Parliament session after the Pahalgam terror attack, the discussions on it and Operation Sindoor remained a highlight of 2025. Take a look at key bills that made the Parliament roar with heated debates.

articles.title: Recognition, funding, autonomy. Educationists divided over single higher education regulator Bill
articles.summary: Vikshit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes setting up an overarching higher education commission along with 3 councils for regulation, accreditation & standards of universities.

articles.summary: Higher Education Commission of India Bill will establish a sole authority for coordinating & determining standards in higher education, research, and scientific & technical institutions.

articles.title: Winter Session 2025: Parliament clocks record productivity as reforms dominate agenda
articles.summary: From sweeping changes in rural employment and labour laws to liberalised FDI norms in insurance and nuclear energy, Parliament’s Winter Session reflected the government’s intent to fast-track structural reforms, even as several measures triggered sharp political and policy pushback.

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: 2025 was a busy trade year for India. King of Tariffs strain, FTA with New Zealand, UK & Oman deals
articles.summary: The year began with two major trade announcements—opening of negotiations for “first tranche” of a bilateral trade agreement with the US following PM Modi’s visit to Washington.

articles.title: Centre ready to revoke X's safe harbour tag to protect citizens: Govt officials
articles.summary: On Friday, the ministry of electronics and information technology (MeitY) had issued a formal notice to X over its AI-powered chatbot Grok being used to generate and spread obscene images and videos of women, and given it 72 hours to remove objectionable content, and take action against offending users. It also threatened to nullify the firm's 'safe harbour' status if it is unable to demonstrate auditable compliance with all rules, especially with regards to hosting sexually explicit content.

articles.title: CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal asks officials to be ready for transition to new I-T Act
articles.summary: The Income Tax Department is gearing up for a significant change. A new direct tax law will be implemented from April 1, 2026, replacing the old Act. CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal has urged officials to be ready and understand the new rules. Training and capacity building are underway to ensure a smooth transition.

articles.title: Grok user making illegal content will suffer same consequence as uploading such content: Musk
articles.summary: Microblogging platform X owner Elon Musk declared users of its AI service Grok generating illegal content will face severe penalties. This follows a directive from India's Ministry of Electronics and IT demanding immediate removal of vulgar and unlawful material.

articles.title: Delhi's EV policy 2.0: Govt to pay owners of old fuel cars for conversion into EVs, check new policy measures
articles.summary: The Delhi government has introduced a new vehicle rule aimed at reducing air pollution. It will provide a Rs 50,000 subsidy for the first 1,000 cars that need modifying to push people to convert their diesel/petrol cars into electric vehicles (EVs). The move is beneficial for those considering scraping or dumping their old vehicles as they would now receive an upgraded version of their old car along with an incentive.

articles.title: SC Assures Representation for Specially Abled Lawyers in Bar Councils
articles.summary: During a recent hearing, the Supreme Court emphasized the need for institutional representation of specially abled lawyers in bar councils, suggesting that statutory amendments may be necessary for future elections.

articles.title: Board of Payments Regulatory Board holds its first meet, reviews draft Payments Vision 2028
articles.summary: The Board reviewed the functions of the Department of Payment and Settlement Systems and current focus areas covering both domestic and global payment systems. The draft Payments Vision 2028 was presented, and Members gave strategic guidance to ensure the continued development of India's payment ecosystem, RBI said in a statement.

articles.title: 'Khelega India!': Sports, fitness may soon be part of skills training
articles.summary: India is integrating sports and fitness into its skill training programs, aiming to enhance trainees' physical resilience and provide a potential second income. This initiative, inspired by Prime Minister Modi's vision, will include mandatory yoga and self-defense training at skill institutes, with certification opportunities. The government also plans to develop sports infrastructure on campus, tailored to regional strengths.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime
articles.summary: In a series of notifications on New Year’s Day, the Finance Ministry announced the end of GST compensation cess, the increase in the excise duty on tobacco products, and the new GST rates on these items as well

During the two-day visit on January 8-9, Goyal will meet the Executive Vice-President and European Commissioner for […]

articles.title: Delhi riots 2020: Supreme Court denies bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam; allows others on 12 conditions
articles.summary: The accused were booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 (UAPA), anti-terror law and provisions of the erstwhile Indian Penal Code (IPC), for allegedly being the "masterminds" of the 2020 riots.

articles.title: ‘Gross violation of AI’: MeitY gives X 72 hours to remove ‘unlawful’ content, warns legal action
articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.title: MeitY takes cognisance of Grok misuse on X, action to follow soon: Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: Why HC registry refused to delete names of Akshay Kumar, PVR & INOX from Bata’s Jolly LLB 2 suit
articles.summary: In 2017 defamation lawsuit, Bata took offence to Jolly LLB 2 trailer scene where Annu Kapoor's character sneered at Akshay Kumar's character by referring to his ‘Bata footwear’.

articles.title: AI-driven inflation is 2026's most overlooked risk, investors say
articles.summary: Global markets have surged on AI optimism, but investors may be overlooking rising inflation risks linked to heavy tech investment. Fund managers warn that government stimulus and AI-driven costs could push inflation higher, forcing central banks to tighten policy. Tighter money would hit tech valuations, profits and investor appetite.

articles.title: Government withdraws import restrictions on low ash met coke with ash content below 18%
articles.summary: The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT), on January 3, amended the import policy of Low Ash Metallurgical Coke, having ash content below 18%, including coke fines/coke breeze and ultra-low phosphorous metallurgical coke, to “free” from “restricted” earlier.

articles.title: India likely to retain 4% inflation target for central bank, Bloomberg News reports
articles.summary: India is expected to maintain its current inflation target for the Reserve Bank of India, with officials deeming the flexible framework effective. The target mandates 4% inflation within a 2% to 6% band, a policy due for renewal in March. This approach, adopted in 2016, has seen inflation remain within the band for most of the past decade.

articles.title: Budget 2026 outlook: Rethinking tax and regulatory policies for a new era of wealth creation
articles.summary: Modern wealth creation offers diverse investment choices. However, India's tax and regulatory systems lag behind this rapid evolution. The upcoming Union Budget 2026-27 presents an opportunity to bridge this gap. Reforms are needed to rationalize tax treatments, incentivize long-term investing, and simplify processes. This will foster entrepreneurship, attract capital, and drive inclusive economic growth for India.

articles.title: India mulls tax exemption for sovereign wealth funds’ equity gains amid heavy foreign outflows
articles.summary: India may exempt Sovereign Wealth Funds and patient capital from taxes on Indian stock market earnings. This proposal aims to attract stable foreign investment following significant sell-offs by foreign fund managers. The government is examining extending these benefits to other long-term investors like pension funds. Such a move could boost capital inflows into the Indian equity market.

articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: A year of insurance reforms in India, yet more ground to cover
articles.summary: Over the past year, India has rewritten key rules governing insurance. Yet for policyholders, the real test lies not in regulation, but in how these changes play out when a claim is filed.

articles.summary: Section of faculty, students and alumni oppose MoSPI's draft Bill that seeks to replace Indian Statistical Institute's elected Governing Council with government-nominated board.

articles.summary: Computer-based tests, if used, should be conducted only in government-controlled centres, a Digvijay Singh-led Standing Committee has said in Parliament.

articles.title: Union Budget: 5 engines India must fire to become a developed nation by 2047
articles.summary: India Budget: India's 2047 developed nation dream hinges on a multi-pronged growth strategy, with the upcoming Budget playing a crucial role. Key focus areas include empowering MSMEs, leveraging technology for efficient governance, bolstering infrastructure, increasing women's workforce participation, and boosting high-value manufacturing. These initiatives are vital for sustained economic progress.

articles.title: AYUSH gets recognition in India's free trade pacts with Oman, New Zealand
articles.summary: India's traditional medicine system, AYUSH, has achieved formal recognition in bilateral trade agreements with Oman and New Zealand. These agreements, finalized last December, include dedicated sections for health services and traditional medicine. AYUSH and herbal product exports saw a growth of 6.11 percent, reaching USD 688.89 million in 2024-25 from USD 649.2 million in 2023-24.

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: Samsung, SK Hynix, Micron shares rise as investors turn to memory chipmakers amid global supply crunch
articles.summary: Memory chip stocks are surging as investors anticipate further price increases. A global supply shortage, fueled by booming demand for artificial intelligence infrastructure, is driving this trend. Industry leaders describe the situation as unprecedented, with constraints expected to last for years. This demand is diverting manufacturing capacity, impacting supply for other sectors.

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Tuesday
articles.summary: Indian markets closed lower as IT stocks and tariff concerns offset positive earnings cues. Nifty held key breakout levels despite profit-taking, while global markets stayed mixed amid geopolitical tensions, rising oil prices and cautious investor sentiment ahead of key data.

articles.title: 'Too cheap to ignore': Jefferies initiates coverage on Emmvee Photovoltaic, sees 70% upside
articles.summary: Jefferies initiates Buy on Emmvee Photovoltaic, citing India’s rapid solar scale-up, strong policy support and cost advantages. It expects installations to grow 24% CAGR, lifting domestic manufacturers’ profitability and positioning Emmvee for high-teen returns despite medium-term margin pressures.

articles.title: Mint Explainer: Why Trump's Venezuela shock is fueling gold, not crude
articles.summary: US action in Venezuela has revived fears over geopolitics, sovereignty, and the safety of paper reserves. While oil prices remain constrained by supply realities, gold is increasingly pricing in a more fragmented and coercive global order.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.title: Five Questions About Money to Ponder in 2026
articles.summary: Stablecoins had their ChatGPT moment in 2025. Payment tokens that were until now used mostly by crypto traders are raring to go mainstream, and not just in the US, where they got regulatory blessing through the Genius Act. Yet just because they’ve pulled ahead, it’s hard to conclude that these 1:1 representation of fiat currencies have won the race. In their quest to come up with the perfect money for the 21st century, market participants will grapple with at least five unanswered questions in 2

articles.summary: Hindustan Laboratories has filed its Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI for an IPO, offering 1.41 million shares. The company aims to leverage fresh capital for working capital needs while providing generic medicines to government institutions.

Both measures will be rolled out over a period of six years (2025-31). Additional Secretary in the Commerce Ministry […]

articles.title: No plan to change land acquisition policy, says cabinet secretary T V Somanathan
articles.summary: Officials said the PRAGATI platform has helped unlock stalled investments by resolving issues linked to land, environment and right of way, enabling large road, rail and power projects to move forward despite persistent structural challenges.

articles.title: Finding growth without overpaying is the real task now, says Axis MF's Shreyash Devalkar
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Shreyash Devalkar said Indian equities are facing valuation pressure as most investment themes are already priced in. He is focusing on growth continuity and GARP opportunities, especially in potential turnaround sectors such as banks, lending, and parts of autos. He highlighted risks in high-valuation sectors, evolving consumption patterns in QSRs, and said inflation and policy cues will be key factors to track going ahead.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: SIR showdown: Mamata to move SC against 'inhumane treatment' of people; cites deaths 'due to fear'
articles.summary: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced plans to approach the Supreme Court, citing "inhumane" conduct during the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. She alleged fear, harassment, and administrative arbitrariness led to deaths and hospitalizations, with names being arbitrarily struck off. Banerjee criticized the process as "unplanned, arbitrary and adhoc," urging its halt to prevent voter disenfranchisement.

articles.title: 'Their action same as Kasab': Giriraj Singh on Umar, Sharjeel's bail denial; welcomes SC's verdict
articles.summary: Union minister Giriraj Singh equated Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam's actions to those of terrorist Kasab, following the Supreme Court's denial of their bail in the 2020 Delhi riots case. The BJP welcomed the verdict, asserting the riots were organized and sponsored, not spontaneous. Khalid, denied bail, stated jail is now his life.

articles.title: ‘Ab yahi zindagi hai’: Umar Khalid reacts after Supreme Court denies bail; partner shares brief chat
articles.summary: Umar Khalid, denied bail by the Supreme Court in the 2020 Delhi riots case, stated prison is now his life. While he expressed happiness for co-accused granted bail, the court found a prima facie case against him under UAPA. The Supreme Court also noted that trial delays don't automatically override UAPA safeguards.

articles.title: Supreme Court grants bail to 5 Delhi riots accused, with 11 conditions
articles.summary: The Supreme Court granted bail to activists Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa Ur Rehman, Mohd. Saleem Khan, and Shadab Ahmad with 11 conditions attached.

articles.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is creating a dichotomy of sorts for India, as the regime change is less about macroeconomics and more about hard cash.

articles.title: Childcare emerges as key HR focus under Social Security Code
articles.summary: India Inc is boosting childcare support as the Social Security Code nears. Nearly 60% of companies have increased budgets for crèches and daycare. This move aims to retain talent and promote workforce diversity. Childcare benefits are now a top HR priority for working parents. The government's initiative strengthens existing provisions for parental support.

articles.title: Make in India: Why sum of parts is bigger than the whole
articles.summary: The Electronics Components Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS) is bolstering domestic production of critical parts, moving beyond mere assembly. With the recent approval of its third tranche, ECMS is fostering a comprehensive electronics ecosystem, aiming to significantly increase local value addition and strengthen supply chain resilience.

articles.title: India’s fiscal fault lines between Centre and states return to the spotlight
articles.summary: Recent changes to India's rural job guarantee scheme have brought back into the spotlight long-running disputes between the Union government and states on how financial resources should be shared.

articles.summary: The interaction with booth-level officers comes as the Election Commission prepares for a state-wide Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, a process that hinges on extensive house-to-house verification and accurate voter data collection at the grassroots level.

articles.title: Fellowships open a door for campus entrepreneurs

There is strong representation from IITs, IIMs, and BITS, with relatively fewer applicants from US or UK universities. Also, India-based applicants skew toward founders, operators, and students, with relatively fewer candidates from a finance background.

The site now reaches 60% of UK internet users, with strong growth among young and female audiences. Partnerships with Google and OpenAI, GenZ seeking real advice and plus live sports discussion, have driven traffic.

articles.title: Nykaa sees Q3 revenue growth in mid-twenties, fashion business continues to lag beauty

Beauty saw its fastest growth in the past six quarters, while fashion lagged due to weaker marketing income streams. The update, issued by the company, is provisional and subject to audit, it said in the filing.

It will offer integrated AI services across consumer products to widen its lead over Apple in such features, though the latter was set be the top smartphone maker last year, according to market ​researcher Counterpoint.

articles.summary: High-profile cases involving women celebrities at the receiving end include the likes of Taylor Swift, whose AI-generated offensive videos have fueled the outcry. Unlike other AI tools, Grok-generated images often appear directly on microblogging site X (formerly Twitter) profiles, allowing abusive content to spread rapidly before it can be moderated. Elon Musk's xAI, which created Grok, merged with X last year.

Sales of electronics like ACs and TVs rose significantly, marking the retail market's best growth phase in over 18 months. Retailers remain cautious but inventory levels have decreased.

articles.title: India's urea imports more than double to 7.17 MT in Apr-Nov: FAI data
articles.summary: India’s urea imports more than doubled to 7.17 million tonnes in April–November of the current fiscal year as domestic production fell, according to Fertiliser Association of India data. Imports rose 120% from a year earlier, while domestic urea output declined 3.7% to 19.75 million tonnes. Overall urea sales increased 2.3% to 25.40 million tonnes, indicating higher demand.

articles.title: UP ‘Shri Anna’ farmer show strong preference for govt procurement over open market sales
articles.summary: Procurement of ‘Shri Anna’, which commenced on October 1, has now been successfully completed. This year, a total of 2.13 lakh metric tonnes of millet, 43,562 metric tonnes of sorghum, and 12,208 metric tonnes of maize were procured across the state. Millet procurement was carried out in 33 districts, maize in 25 districts, and sorghum in 11 districts.

articles.title: India becomes world's largest rice producer, surpasses China: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan
articles.summary: India has become the world's largest rice producer, surpassing China. The nation achieved this milestone with a total output of 150.18 million tonnes. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan released 184 new high-yielding seed varieties for 25 crops. These advancements aim to boost crop production and increase farmer income, ensuring India's food security and global food supply.

articles.title: Tax hike raises risk of smuggling of tobacco products and revenue loss for govt: Experts
articles.summary: Experts warn that a significant tax hike on cigarettes, effective February 1, could fuel illicit trade and lead to substantial tax revenue losses. The new excise duty structure, combined with existing GST, represents a 60-70% increase, potentially driving consumers towards smuggled products. This move risks amplifying India's already substantial illicit tobacco market.

articles.title: Agritech Unnati acquires Gramophone; Info Edge to transfer stake, infuse Rs 35 crore

articles.summary: New Delhi: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) has suspended a professor from its department of social work over a question he set on “atrocities against Muslims in India” in a semester exam paper. According to university officials, there were complaints over a question in the BA (Hons) Social Work first-semester examination held earlier this week in […]

articles.title: UGC tells universities to prevent entry of stray dogs in campus, calls for ’round-the-clock vigil’
articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Parsis to Tibetans, India ‘safe haven’ for ‘persecuted communities’ for centuries—new Class 7 NCERT book
articles.summary: Previous NCERT social science textbooks didn't have such a chapter. No connection to CAA controversy, says NCERT director.

articles.title: Congress 140th foundation day: Mallikarjun Kharge says Congress is an ideology and 'ideologies never die'
articles.summary: Congress marks 140th Foundation Day as Mallikarjun Kharge highlights its enduring ideology, historic milestones, and commitment to democracy and unity.

articles.title: Mumbai civic polls: Congress and Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi seal alliance
articles.summary: The tie-up decision was announced by Maharashtra Congress president Harshwardhan Sapkal and VBA state vice-president Dhairyavardhan Pundkar.

articles.title: 140 years of the Indian National Congress: Where is the Grand Old party headed
articles.summary: Founded on December 28, 1885, the Indian National Congress completed 140 years today. The Grand Old Party emerged as the principal movement through which India fought for Independence. Now, with its hoary past behind it, the party stands at a crossroads—searching for political direction even as it remains a potent force in the country’s changing landscape. Where is it headed? Political analyst and writer K.V. Prasad explains.

articles.title: There will be respectable alliance of Shiv Sena-BJP for civic body polls: Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: Talking to reporters here, shinde said the alliance talks between the two parties are almost in final stages for the civic body polls in Thane Kalyan Dombivli, Mira Bhayandar and Navi Mumbai civic bodies.
